Key Match Events: Granit Xhaka received his first red card in 32 months for a foul on former Tottenham man Pierre-Emile Højbjerg
Xhaka's emotions got the better of him after Denmark took the lead, resulting in his second yellow card and subsequent dismissal
Post-Match Reflections: Xhaka admitted that he has become calmer in recent years but is still a person who is very emotional, especially when things are going wrong
Xhaka apologised to his teammates on social media, acknowledging the impact of his dismissal on the result
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match turned chaotic in the second half as two Swiss players were sent off, including Xhaka
Denmark added to Switzerland's misery by scoring a second goal in stoppage time, with Højbjerg finding the net to seal a 2-0 win
Others: The red card marks the 16th dismissal of Xhaka's professional career, spanning 735 matches at both club and international levels
Xhaka will miss Switzerland's next Nations League fixture against Spain due to his suspension
